Verification of the source: The expert identified that the claim was made by a user on Facebook, specifically a verified account with a large following called Kollege Kidd. This verification of the source helps establish the authenticity of the claim.
Analysis of the images: The expert conducted reverse image searches and determined that the photos shared in the claim were not recent and were taken out of context. They were found to be depicting old missile strikes, including attacks by Iran against the Islamic State in Syria and Israeli missile strikes in the Gaza Strip. This analysis of the images helped verify the inaccuracy of the claim.
Comparison with official footage: The expert mentioned that Iran had released footage of their actual missile strike in Iraq on January 7, 2020, which showed no reported casualties. By comparing the claim's photos with the official footage, it further confirmed the false nature of the claim.
Collaboration with Facebook: s efforts: The expert highlighted that the flagged images were part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its platform. This collaboration with Facebook's fact-checking initiatives adds another layer of verification to the claim's inaccuracy.
